intro: Margaritopsis obanensis, commonly known as the Oban rock-rose, is a flowering plant native to the Scottish Highlands. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant produces small, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are opposite, linear, and covered in fine hairs. Margaritopsis obanensis is adapted to grow in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments.
